title: Thunderlord's Decree game breaking bug [Gameplay]
body: Currently the Keystone Mastery Thunderlord's Decree has a huge gamebreaking bug in which if more than one person on the same team have that mastery, only one of them works throughout the game. I don't know which one works but I think it is whoever has higher pick order. This is soooo bad because it basically means the person(s) who can't use the mastery basically get shafted and they don't have a keystone mastery. I don't know how this bug isn't hotfixed yet.

This is definitely a serious bug that needs to be fixed as soon as possible, but you shouldn't label it "game breaking". Game breaking would mean that the game is unplayable, either because something is so ridiculously OP that you can't fight against it, or because it glitches the game so hard that you can't meaningfully play it. Neither of those are the case here.

It's a lot more game breaking than a champion just being overpowered.

As we've seen with... basically every champion effected in the last 10 patches, being overpowered isn't game breaking.
Just being overpowered is not game breaking. Being overpowered to the point that you have 80%+ win rates, however, would be considered "game breaking".
Game breaking doesn't mean the game is unplayable. It means that theres something unfair and drastic that shouldn't be there.

The reason why I asked is because attack damage consists of base attack damage and bonus attack damage. Most abilities/items deal damage according to bonus attack damage or total attack damage, and that is why I questioned you about it. I didn't ask for ability power because you always start at 0 AP (there is no "base ability power" or "bonus ability power"), regardless of champion.
